Module paceManager
Package data

Class Pace

java.lang.Object
data.Pace
public class Pace
extends java.lang.Object
Class representing the combined data for a given Pace. Includes methods for saving or loading a pace
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Thomas Kwashnak

  • Field Details

    • uuid

      private final java.util.UUID uuid
      Unique Identifier of the Pace
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • divisions

      private final java.util.List<Division> divisions
      List of all divisions included in the pace. The first division listed is considered the "default" division, and cannot (or should not) be removed from the list (resulting in an empty list). Any teams that have no division selected will be automatically included in this division
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • teams

      private final java.util.List<Team> teams
      List of all teams in the pace
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • file

      private transient java.io.File file
      The file that the pace is stored in. If the pace is brand new, or does not have a file, this value is null. The data is stored in the file in a JSON file format, regardless of whether the extension is of any extension listed in Settings.getFileExtensions()
      Since:
      1.0.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Pace

      public Pace()
      Creates a new pace, initializing values.
      Since:
      1.0.0

  • Method Details

    • fromFile

      public static Pace fromFile​(java.io.File file)
      Attempts to create a new pace from a given file.

      If the file doesn't exist, or if there are errors in parsing the file, returns a new Pace object with a reference to that file, such that the pace will save to that file.

      Parameters:
      file - File reference to the saved pace data
      Returns:
      A Pace object, set to save to the provided file. The Pace object is an empty pace if there were errors in parsing the file
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • fromJson

      public static Pace fromJson​(com.google.gson.stream.JsonReader reader)
      Returns a pace object derived from a Json reader. Populates divisions and updates the division list.
      Parameters:
      reader - JsonReader to read the pace data from
      Returns:
      Pace object derived from data in the JsonReader
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getDivisions

      public java.util.List<Division> getDivisions()
      Gets a list of divisions
      Returns:
      List of division included in the pace
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getTeams

      public java.util.List<Team> getTeams()
      Gets a list of teams
      Returns:
      List of teams tracked in the pace
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • updateDivisionLists

      public void updateDivisionLists()
      Wipes out all division team lists and repopulates them
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • populateDivisions

      public void populateDivisions()
      Populates each team's Division value based on their DivisionUUID parameter
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • save

      public void save()
      Attempts to save the Pace to the file specified
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • serialize

      public void serialize​(java.io.Writer writer)
      Serializes the data within this object to a writer
      Parameters:
      writer - Writer to serialize the data to
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • getFile

      public java.io.File getFile()
      Gets the save file
      Returns:
      File referencing the location of save-data for the pace
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      file

      Sets the save file
      Parameters:

    • newDivision

      public java.util.UUID newDivision​(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new division from a given name, adding it to the list, and returning its UUID
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the new division
      Returns:
      UUID of the newly created division
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • addDivision

      public void addDivision​(Division division)
      Adds a given division to the list
      Parameters:
      division - Division to add to the list
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • removeDivision

      public boolean removeDivision​(Division division)
      Removes a given division from the list. Will not remove the division if the provided division is the current default division.
      Parameters:
      division - Division to remove
      Returns:
      true if removing was successful, false if the division is not in the list, or if the division is the default division and cannot be removed

    • setDefaultDivision

      public boolean setDefaultDivision​(Division division)
      Sets the default division

      Useful if there is a need for changing default divisions to remove the previous default division

      Parameters:
      division - Division to set as default
      Returns:
      true if the provided division was set as default, false if the division is not in the current list of divisions, or it is already the default division

    • pingUpdate

      public void pingUpdate()
      Lets the pace know that there has been an update to one of its child objects
